alert.note: Alert for Sweet Grass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 11:24AM MDT until June 14 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Boulder River at Big Timber affecting Sweet Grass County. .Combination of rainfall and melting snow is expected to push the Boulder River above flood stage. How far above flood stage the Boulder River will rise is hard to determine due to uncertainties with the rain falling on the snow in the high country. As a result the forecast crest should be used as a starting point and not a definite peak. If you live or are recreating along the river be prepared for flooding. Additional updates to the river forecast and warning will be updated as more information becomes available. For the Boulder River...including Big Timber...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Boulder River at Big Timber. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Minor flooding along the south bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM MDT Monday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 8.1 feet this afternoon. It will fall below flood stage later this evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.0 feet on 06/30/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Boulder River Big Timber 8.0 7.9 Mon 9 am 7.0 5.9 5.5 &&
info.instruction: To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM MDT.
